title: Works!
comment: A really excellent app. The paid version is worth it. It is fairly easy to come to grips with.  Menu items are not buried too deeply.  In several hours of trying things out I did not crash it, and my Aldi tablet is fairly humble in the specs dept.   It allows you to set things up the way you prefer.  It has no issues with the external SD card. You can navigate bush tracks, great for hiking or biking. It is easy to save favourites, plot courses, change settings etc.  It feels as though a lot of thought and work has gone into making it usable.

New Zealand maps need a lot of work - they don't have street numbers, meaning you can't navigate to a street address, just an intersection. Also, the main feature I bought this app for - being able to plan a route (rather than fully automatic calculated routing) is very non-intuitive to use, requiring saving of a GPX track first, then using that in calculating your route. When I tried doing that, I got "Error saving GX file" and nothing more.

The maps are made by volunteer online contributors, some details may be missing. You can add those details using the OSM edit plugin. As for GPX saving, this might help http://osmand.net/help/faq.html#failed_to_use_sdcard_on_4_4

title: Amazing app

Potentially excellent but right now pretty poor. For example, when displaying cycle routes it's impossible to see if the transparent red route on a yellow road is the route, or if it's an orange road. Yes, you can tell if you look really closely, but that isn't possible while riding.  Instructions are not only minimal but incomprehensible as they refer to menus and settings that don't come with the download.   I should have tried the free version first.

5 stars, because of the hard work you do. But I have one question and want a honest answer - where is free text address search (when online) and why did you remove it in the new interface ?! That's a major feature and it works good . It seems that it uses Google (Maps) Search - is there some licensing problem ? Please answer.

it's still possible to search for addresses: go to starting screen and choose Search for - Address. You can also press Search for POI, then start entering your address and choose online nominatim-addresses.

It covers everything you may need. Just perfect. One minor remark/suggestion: To me it seems strange that the POIs that appear on the map by default (are part of the map) are not interactive (you cannot click on them or read information of them), but you have to do a manual search or display them separately, after which the clickable interactive orange-colored POIs will appear on the map. title: the BEST offline maps + navigation program available
comment: I've tried so many different map/navigation apps, but I always come back to this one - for driving, hiking, biking and sightseeing in cities.  -It has a the MOST features. Of course, you will need a bit time to learn all the program can do, but it is worth your time!  -It makes you completely independent of an online connection. Going to a new place/city/country? Just download maps, points of interest, wikipedia articles etc at home on your phone - and when you are travelling, you will have everything in your pocket you need (where's the next pharmacy, when was this church built, where is the next metro station) - all without having to go online.  -Is has a very fair business model (you get everything for free! You get all features, plus 10 maps for free. And you can always make your own maps using open data - you ONLY pay for the convenience of getting unlimited global pre-compiled maps, and for the good feeling of supporting the developers - and they continually improve the program)  -They keep adding great features: ability to edit/correct OSM map data, to track your location and share with others, to save your parking spot, altitude lines, hillshade, ... ...

This is a common error with the Play Store. Basically, there is some app data left behind from a previous installation of the app. The Play Store throws a -24 error because it doesn't know what to do with it. 
Please go to data/data on your phone, find the package name OsmAnd and delete it. Reinstall the app and it should work fine.

title: OsmAnd is now my preferred on-road SatNav.
comment: In most situations it beats all alternatives I‘ve researched and tested ie walking, cycling and driving in UK, Netherlands, Spain, Italy, Cyprus, Poland, Germany.. . .For normal use, the maps are bettered only by UK Ordnance Survey!. . .Voice directions enable the screen to be mostly off. Saves battery! Screen “wakes up” when directions are delivered. . . Speed limit warnings – Brill. . . Easy to find facilities, eg shop, room, viewpoint, etc. . .. . .Want basic, average, run-of-the-mill, totally intuitive SatNav? Look elsewhere and accept mediocrity.  . . Want really good SatNav with many benefits, try OsmAnd and be willing to learn to use it. . . Then go for OsmAnd+.  Better value for money than a couple of beers! . .  . . Summary – OsmAnd, in common with other SatNav, is not perfect but it is one of the best, and keeps getting better. Worth tolerating the quirks to enjoy the benefits. . . I used to love paper maps, but no longer need them.  OsmAnd is more powerful.  Liberates you from the navigation to enjoy the locality. . . Very good value for money. . . Recommended to family and friends.

title: Pretty good but...
comment: I bought this so I could define a route offline and import a gpx. It opens the gpx and routes as desired, hitting all the scenic routes etc. The problem is that it can only traverse the entire gpx. If you deviate from the route it tries to reroute back to the start. We stopped for lunch 100' off the road and it did this. "Delete waypoint" did not work on the route so I had to use a text editor to delete route points then re-start so we could carry on. Not a happy moment, yet often repeated. OTOH, without a gpx it works very well, aside from the occasional bizarre routing like off and immediately on at the same exit. Offline maps a must in the back country. 1.8.3, Android 4.2.1.

title: Problematic
comment: OsmAnd+ is not capable of calculating offline routes to far objectives (lets say 800km). This means it is useless for large trips. You can use it to navigate to close objectives. comment: Just took a roadtrip with friends across 5 us states. Since we knew we'd have little to no network connection we used this in place of Google maps. Google's calculation (of the same OSM route) told us a trip would take just over 3 hours, whereas OSM said 5.5hrs...

This isn't gps - you get maps and 10 segments loaded 2.5gb but not onto my sd card. That takes more than 15 minutes so no refund possible. This is the worst gps program ever.
Please contact support at osmand.app+support@gmail.com for assistance. Thank you.
Best offline gps ever used

title: Great App, but
comment: I've been using your app for years, and it's come a long way.  But, when are you going to put a Directions/Navigation button on the startup screen, and when the heck are you going to fix the address search?  You can't just type in an address like every other mapping program in the world?  You know, based on the postal standard?  I can't even put in a street number!  Not everything on a road has a cross street!  Having the pass along the whole track is perhaps the most important thing you offer that makes it more useful than all the others.  Very important for custom routes and sightseeing that's not optimal in any way.  For me, life's a journey, not a destination.  Also, when importing a GPX file with waypoints, please have the option to recalculate and show it attached to roads, optimized based on settings, and the ability to drag to modify/add via point.
Great app and plugins!

When you first start OsmAnd, you should see the dialog of switching folder to SD card, so you can download maps. The dialog will suggest to "move to SD card" (or it stays "move to internal storage"). This dialog is also present in Settings → General → Storage directory.

title: Some very good bits but Favourites could use some work
comment: Some very good bits, some not so good.  The POI are nice but they're somebody else's POI and probably only commercial concerns so I find favourites more useful because they're just my favourites  Displaying Favourites on the map can be a real pain if there are a lot of them as they obscure parts of the map and add to general confusion -  an easy to access toggle to show/hide favourites would be very helpful.  Currently favourites can only be grouped in a simple 1 level hierarchy. Multi-level hierarchy would be nice and/or tags and then (saved) filtered views of favourites on the map. Think - "I want to go out on a bike ride to local fungus woods and maybe stop at a pub for lunch so show me my favourites tagged with 'fungi', 'pub', food'" - maybe tags would be best:-).

title: I really wanted to love this app .. but ...

Actually have more options and fine tuning maybe then all others put together and I love this, but as for job for which is meant it is just bad(missing many times by 50/100m, indicating wrong direction, insisting for minutes to turn around sometimes even when car in mean time is already nearly at destination, long delay before recalculating new route (others i.e. Copilot, Sygic are nearly instant). Display is constantly shaking, adjusting, moving in steps, ... Navigation improves many times a lot after fresh restart of phone, but no other I have tested (Navfree, Copilot, Sygic, Navigator, ...) have this problems or maybe just once in awhile. As I have purchased will still keep it on my phone just really hope for some redone version. Then might give more then 1 star. About missing street numbers note that this is fault of OSM!! Addendum 29-5-13: agree with reply, much better now. Addendum: 9-11-13: added another star, they are really improving app constantly.

There was a bug causing shakes in navigation (setting enable compass was not working as expected). In latest release 1.3.1 it was switched off and now it should be smooth.
Route calculation is not fast if your route is  more than 100km and can take 1 min (initial calculation) 15 seconds (recalc) and also limited to 300km. But we are working on it!

title: Good app, great value
comment: Would be a 5 star app if some of the maps were more logical. For instance, I'm currently in the Mongol Rally, driving from London to Mongolia. To get across Russia, I need to download over 80 separate maps, as they are listed by city and not region, and figuring out which are applicable for my journey would be painstakingly long. It would be great if they could be organized by region (i.e. South-east, South-west, etc.) or if there was a file for the basic highway routes, and additional files for each city. It would be better even, if I was able to just download the whole of Russia in one go rather than storing all of them separately.  I quite frequently get a "not enough process memory error" despite being on the Nexus 7 with a plethora of extra process memory available. This error causes map data to not load. Additionally, the app occasionally crashes entirely with no explanation aside from "OSMAnd+ has stopped"  Overall, worthy of the money and totally capable of nearly all navigation needs. I was using NavFree before and prefer this, mostly for the complete database of maps, but partially due to GUI superiority.

title: This app has been fantastic!
comment: Using this app while travelling lets you view streets, suburbs, countries, the nearest restaurants, take away, 4wd tracks, points of interest and it is all off line.  Driving with the family at night, the kids woke up and wanted dinner, so we just diverted our trip to the list of take away outlets. Osmand directed us directly to the location without a hitch. At our destination, we needed to find a supermarket that was still open, so we did a quick offline search and Osmand directed us to it as well.  Being a keen mapper with OSM, I have been adding pois, streets, opening hours, adding petrol stations, etc. It is very easy to add items via Osmand. After travelling, all you do is export directly to OSM and within approx 2 weeks, it is all available for everyone to use. You can also save your entire trip out as a gpx file. It couldn't be easier.  There are also a few plugins such as contour lines and hill shade -- which are great for 4wding and camping. You also have access to offline wikipedia poi.

title: Amazing
comment: It took me a long time and several attempts to find a decent offline GPS for travelling etc. This one is so much better than anything else I tried. Used it on my previous InterRail trip and never got lost.  Unfortunately some maps (such as California) were rather slow on HTC wildfire S, but luckily it got stolen and my new Motorola Atrix runs Osmand+ very smoothly. I used the free version at first, but wikipedia POI and unlimited map download were very much worth the ridiculously low price. If there is a better product on the market I would be surprised.

title: Best GPS offline app I have found
comment: A real GPS is still the best, but Osmand is getting very close and far the best offline app I have found. It is quite easy to learn to use, and have many nice features and lot of maps.  Challenges: * It can take very long time to find the satellite position, it is therefore a good ide also to install gps finders like GPSFix, GPS status or GPS Test. * Some times Osmand can not find a given street in address search even though the street is on the map. Normally it helps to search by zip code instead of City. * It would be very good if it was possible to search for a street name in a hole country instead of only a specific city. Osmand guys keep up the good work.

title: Incredibly Useful and Well Done

The map itself has helped me learn the area and find important things like food, banks, and beer.   The interface is very nice but there were a few things which didn't seem intuitive. All of them combined didn't warrant a demotion in my rating though. If you have an older phone with little memory (the maps can be very large) then this app isn't for you.

title: Good
comment: Good and handy app. Need more info on the screen whole biking, like altitude, distance to next turn. Need auto route recalculation if I missed a turn. Usability for routing needs to be improved, like "navigate from current position to" with one tap. Need alternative route and route change by dragging of way point. Need route build from waypoint to waypoint. Need support for opening fox and kml files via intent from other apps.

The program still has some bugs, and part of the interface needs improvement, but I highly recommend it and I am sure it will become one of the greatest apps ever
